image:image.image:caption: An unusual carved mahogany sofa, the channelled dipped back with padded arms supported by brass fluted and flared columns and feet with alabaster ball capitals, the cushion seat above a scroll carved and gilt seat rail.
image:image.image:title: Beauharnais Sofa

image:image.image:caption: A swirl mahogany and yew burl veneered King bed, the serpentine headboard with brass inlaid details and an upholstered panel surrounded by gilt moulding, flanked by turned and reeded ebonised and gilt columns with brass finials, the recessed panel rails with ebony and sycamore stringing, on ebonised and gilt fluted tapering feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Manor US Queen Bed

image:image.image:caption: A swirl mahogany and yew burl veneered King bed, the serpentine headboard with brass inlaid details and an upholstered panel surrounded by gilt moulding, flanked by turned and reeded ebonised and gilt columns with brass finials, the recessed panel rails with ebony and sycamore stringing, on ebonised and gilt fluted tapering feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Manor Bed (US King)

image:image.image:caption: A fine flame mahogany and Morado banded bed with brass inlaid details, the arched headboard with brass inlaid rosettes flanked by brass finial columns in hand carved mahogany with gilt and ebonised details, the tufted upholstered headboard with a gilt edge, on panelled and brass bead moulded rails with ebonised and gilt mahogany feet with bold brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: European Nights (US King) Bed

image:image.image:caption: A fine mahogany, cerejeira veneered and mother of pearl inlaid pedestal desk, the moulded edge top inset with a central leather writing surface with a cable hole, flanked by mother of pearl inlaid fan medallions, with three frieze drawers above three further drawers to one pedestal and one short and one filing drawer to the other, the reverse with a mother of pearl inlaid modesty panel. Inspired by a George III original in the Neo-Classical style.
image:image.image:title: The Master's Craft Pedestal Desk

image:image.image:caption: A chestnut burl, walnut and mahogany console table, the serpentine top with brass inlay and crossbanded in walnut, above two panelled drawers, on turned and chestnut burl veneered legs joined by a serpentine undertier, the legs terminating in reeded brass feet.
image:image.image:title: Trebeck Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and satinwood strung bedside table, the 'D' top with a brass inlaid edge above a frieze drawer and yew burl veneered corner panels, on ebonised and gilt reeded supports joined by a swirl mahogany and satinwood banded undertier, on splayed feet with finely cast brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Bedide Companion Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A very fine pleated upholstered and mother of pearl framed King bed, the stainless steel framed and mother of pearl cartouche headboard above ebonised rails with faux shagreen embossed leather rails, on stainless steel cabriole legs.
image:image.image:title: Chateau Nights (US King) Bed

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and burl sunburst parquetry oval lamp table, with brass gallery and fluted column, on ‘C’ scroll legs. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: Radiating Parquetry Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved armchair, the carved and pierced serpentine vase splat above an upholstered drop in seat on cabriole legs with claw and ball feet.
image:image.image:title: Classic Claw And Ball Armchair

image:image.image:caption: An ebonised Pacific walnut veneered nightstand, the oval reeded edge top with a sweeping half gallery above three bowed drawers with Paktong handles, on an ebonised veneered base with turned tapering legs terminating in Paktong feet.
image:image.image:title: Charterhouse Nightstand

image:image.image:caption: A finely carved mahogany and gilt dining arm chair, the padded back with a coronet carved crest and a carved frame, the reverse inlaid with okumé veneer and mother of pearl, the upholstered seat on turned and fluted legs.
image:image.image:title: The King's Armchair

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and satinwood strung accent table, the break-bowfront sides with a brass inlaid edge over ebony, above a frieze drawer and yew burl veneered corner panels, on ebonised and gilt reeded supports joined by a swirl mahogany and satinwood banded undertier, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: The Craftsman's Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany, swirl mahogany veneered, Morado and yew burl banded extending dining table, the circular brass inlaid edged top with six radial expansion leaves supported on pull out lopers, on reeded column and brass mounted supports and a shaped base issuing four downswept reeded legs with reeded brass cappings. The top with brass a brass inlaid edge against ebony when open and closed.
image:image.image:title: Gabrielle's Extending Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A laurel burl veneer and solid acacia console table, the rectangular top with rounded ends with a three quarter pierced brass gallery above two long frieze drawers, on turned and tapering fluted legs joined by an undertier similar to the top. Inspired by a Louis XVI original
image:image.image:title: The Rounded Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A finely carved mahogany and gilt dining side chair, the padded back with a coronet carved crest and a carved frame, the reverse inlaid with okumé veneer and mother of pearl, the upholstered seat on turned and fluted legs.
image:image.image:title: The King's Side chair

image:image.image:caption: A leather panelled footstool, the overscroll upholstered seat with brass roundels, on wavy leather panelled 'X' supports.
image:image.image:title: Marshall Stool

image:image.image:caption: An okumé veneered, ebonised and mother of pearl inlaid dining table, the rectangular mother of pearl line strung top crossbanded with imbuya and inlaid with delicate scrolling vines, with rounded corners and a delicately mother of pearl inlaid frieze, on four inlaid column supports joined by an undertier and issuing ebonised splayed legs with fine brass cappings. Inspired by a George III original in the Neo-Classical style.
image:image.image:title: Seraphina Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A laurel burl and mother of pearl inlaid library bookcase, the pagoda cornice above two glazed doors enclosing two adjustable glass shelves and a mirror back, the two frieze drawers above cabinet doors enclosing an adjustable shelf. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Laurel Burl and Mother of Pearl Inlaid Library Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: A sycamore veneered and mahogany bar cabinet, the cabinet with gradated lacquered doors and stainless steel handles opening to reveal a sycamore veneered and glass shelved interior with lights, with a quarter round chequer banded moulded edge above a gently undulating apron with a rotating bowfront slide and drawer, on tapering legs with scroll feet.
image:image.image:title: The Cocktail Cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and yew burl banded TV cabinet, the break bowfront top with brass inlaid details to the edge, above three line strung DVD drawers centred by yew burl panels, flanked by bowed and recessed panelled cabinet doors each enclosing an adjustable shelf, and turned and tapering ebonised columns, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Lieven TV cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A sable, silvered and hand-painted Argento and floral decorated bed, the leaf carved serpentine head and footboard, on carved cabriole legs. The original Louis XV.
image:image.image:title: Enchanted Evening US Queen Bed

image:image.image:caption: A fine mahogany and upholstered sofa, the undulating padded toprail above a padded back and cushion seat between scroll over arms, the seat rail with parcel gilt mouldings enclosing a leather frieze overlaid with brass swords, on finely cast brass feet.
image:image.image:title: Italian Repose Sofa

image:image.image:caption: Hand Leafed Brushed Pewter FinishHand Leafed Silver Eglomisé TopTrellis Sides
image:image.image:title: Connaught Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A fine cerejeira veneered, mother of pearl inlaid and Morado crossbanded media console, the breakfront top above four frieze drawers and four mother of pearl fan medallion inlaid doors enclosing adjustable shelves, on a plinth base with bracket feet.
image:image.image:title: The Master's Art Media Console

image:image.image:caption: A silvered leaf and faux shagreen embossed leather inlaid nightstand, the serpentine moulded edge marble top above two trellis tooled faux shagreen leather bombe drawers fitted with stainless steel handles, on cabriole legs. Inspired by a Louis XV original.
image:image.image:title: Trianon Nightstand

image:image.image:caption: A fine swirl mahogany veneer, satinwood, imbuya and walnut burl banded rectangular dining table, the scrolling vine inlaid border with mother of pearl inlaid flowers flanked by brass stringing, the moulded edge above a brass Vitruvian scroll applied frieze, on solid mahogany carved scroll bases applied with finely cast brass floral swags and acanthus leaf cappings on a trefoil plinth base with bracket feet.
image:image.image:title: The Important Gathering Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: An unusual carved mahogany loveseat, the channelled dipped back with padded arms supported by brass fluted and flared columns and feet with alabaster ball capitals, the cushion seat above a scroll carved and gilt seat rail. Inspired by an Empire original.
image:image.image:title: Rose-Claire Sofa

image:image.image:caption: A sable, silvered and hand-painted Argento and floral decorated bed, the leaf carved serpentine head and footboard, on carved cabriole legs. The original Louis XV.
image:image.image:title: Enchanted Evening (US King) Bed

image:image.image:caption: A flame mahogany and satinwood banded TV console, the break bowfront top with an ebony and brass inlaid edge above two central yew burl veneered panel drawers, the upper drawer with a fall front; flanked by panelled and brass line strung cabinet doors enclosing adjustable shelves, on ebonised and gilt tapering fluted legs with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: The Executive At Ease TV Console

image:image.image:caption: A fine okumé veneered, ebonised, mother of pearl inlaid and Morado crossbanded buffet, the breakfront top above three frieze drawers above a central bank of three further drawers, flanked by two mother of pearl fan medallion inlaid doors enclosing adjustable shelves, on a plinth base. Inspired by a George III original in the Neo-Classical style.
image:image.image:title: The Master's Craft buffet

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and yew burl banded chest of drawers, the break bowfront top with brass inlaid details to the edge, above an arrangement of bowed and line strung mahogany drawers centred by yew burl panels, with three frieze drawers and three long drawers below, flanked by turned and tapering columns, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Lieven Chest

image:image.image:caption: An unusual mahogany and gilt open armchair, the arched pack with a pierced splat and padded wings, the scroll terminal arms enclosing a tufted seat, on leaf carved cabriole legs.
image:image.image:title: Francine Dining Chair

image:image.image:caption: A fine mahogany and upholstered loveseat, the undulating padded toprail above apadded back and cushion seat between scroll over arms, the seat rail with parcel giltmouldings enclosing a leather frieze overlaid with brass swords, on finely castbrass feet.
image:image.image:title: Italian Loveseat

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and yew burl banded TV cabinet, the break bowfront top with brass inlaid details to the edge, above two line strung DVD drawers centred by yew burl panels, flanked by bowed and recessed panelled double cabinet doors each enclosing an adjustable shelf, and turned and tapering ebonised columns, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Coveted TV cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered mechanical extending dining table, the brass bound top with crossbanding and ribbon twist brass and mother of pearl inlays sliding open to reveal an additional leaf raising as an extension, on a turned column with splayed parcel gilt downswept legs terminating in brass capping and casters.
image:image.image:title: Sympathy Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A finely carved and gilt mahogany loveseat, the curved and gently arched upholstered back above a serpentine cushion seat, the relief carved leaf arms above a moulded seat rail and on splayed cabriole legs with scroll feet. Inspired by a late 19th century European original
image:image.image:title: Francois

image:image.image:caption: A flame mahogany and satinwood banded TV console, the break bowfront top with an ebony and brass inlaid edge above a fall front yew burl panel and ebony strung drawer, the panelled cabinet below enclosing a shelf; flanked by two banks of three drawers and ebonised and gilt reeded columns, on a triple strung plinth base.
image:image.image:title: The Craftsman's Entertainer TV Console

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and yew burl banded nightstand, the break bowfront top with brass edge inlay, above three bowed and line strung drawers, flanked by yew burl panels and turned and tapering ebonised and gilt columns, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: The Craftsman's Nightstand

image:image.image:caption: A silvered leaf and faux shagreen embossed leather inlaid tall chest, the rectangular top above five trellis tooled leather drawers with nail head details and stainless steel handles, within an ebonised frame, on torpedo legs. In the manner of Paul Follot (1877 - 1941), circa 1920.
image:image.image:title: Follot Tall Chest

image:image.image:caption: A silvered leaf and faux shagreen embossed leather inlaid nightstand, the rectangular marble inset top above two trellis tooled leather drawers within an ebonised frame, the torpedo legs joined by a concave sided undertier with tooled and nailed shagreen leather. In the manner of Paul Follot (1877 - 1941), circa 1920.
image:image.image:title: Follot Nightstand

image:image.image:caption: A fine swirl mahogany veneer, satinwood, imbuya and walnut burl banded circular dining table, the scrolling vine inlaid border with mother of pearl inlaid flowers flanked by brass stringing, the moulded edge above a brass Vitruvian scroll applied frieze, on a solid mahogany carved scroll base applied with finely cast brass floral swags and acanthus leaf cappings on a trefoil plinth base with bracket feet. The top with a moulded edge and crossbanded 34" Lazy Susan.
image:image.image:title: The Convivial Host Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A fine flame mahogany and imbuya inlaid dining table, the mother of pearl panelled top with fine scrolling vine inlays above a mother of pearl swag inlaid apron, on four panelled columns with mother pearl trailing husk inlay, a panelled platform tier issuing ebonised mahogany downswept legs with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Historic Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A silvered leaf and faux shagreen embossed leather media console, the inset marble top above two central leather panelled, nailed and circle tooled drawers flanked by two cabinet doors, within an ebonised framed and on torpedo supports. In the manner of Paul Follot (1877 - 1941), circa 1920.
image:image.image:title: Follot Media Console

image:image.image:caption: A George III laurel burl veneered and Morado crossbanded console table, the bowfront brass bound top with mother of pearl and brass ribbon inlay, the brass inlaid frieze with a bowfront drawer and brass handles, supported with panelled legs with gilt trailing husk carved decoration and brass feet, joined by a shelved brass bound undertier.
image:image.image:title: Laurel Burl Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A pollard burl and mother of pearl inlaid lamp table, the square moulded edge top above a panelled frieze drawer, the ebonised turned legs joined by an undertier. Inspired by a 19th century Italian original.
image:image.image:title: Turquoise Encounter Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An ebonised mahogany and gilt bench, the rectangular seat above wavy 'X' supports.
image:image.image:title: Empire Original Benche

image:image.image:caption: A okumé kidney shaped lamp table, with fine brass mounts, with a frieze drawer and cabriole legs terminating in brass paw feet. Inspired by a Louis XV original.
image:image.image:title: Okumé Kidney Shaped Lamp Table

image:image.image:caption: A okumé veneered lamp table, the circular brass bound top above three finely brass mounted and ebonised column legs, on a concave sided trefoil base. The original Empire, circa 1810.
image:image.image:title: 1810 Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved side chair, the carved and pierced serpentine vase splat above an upholstered drop in seat on cabriole legs with claw and ball feet.
image:image.image:title: Classic Claw and Ball Side chair

image:image.image:caption: A bowfront silvered and hand carved vanity console table, the demi lune top and sides inset with shagreen embossed leather, above reeded Javelin legs.
image:image.image:title: Enchanted Writings Dressing Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and satinwood strung cocktail table, the breakfront sides and 'D' end top with a brass inlaid edge above two frieze drawers and a concealed centre drawer in yew burl veneer, on reeded ebonised and gilt supports joined by a swirl mahogany and satinwood banded undertier, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.
image:image.image:title: Windsor Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A finely carved ebonised mahogany bench or window seat, the scroll over padded arm and buttoned seat above a carved seat rail and cabriole legs.
image:image.image:title: Versailles Charm Bench

image:image.image:caption: A finely hand carved mahogany, mother of pearl inlaid and okumé veneered display cabinet, the bowfront glazed upper section with turned and fluted columns, enclosing a mirror back and two adjustable glass shelves, the lower console section with a brass detailed drawer and hand carved apron below, on turned and fluted legs joined by an undertier and with brass feet. Inspired by a Napoleon III original.
image:image.image:title: Jeanne Bar / Curio Cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A pollard burl and mother of pearl inlaid cocktail table, the square moulded edge top above panelled frieze drawers, the ebonised turned legs joined by a concave sided undertier. Inspired by a 19th century Italian original.
image:image.image:title: Turquoise Encounter Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A carved mahogany and okumé veneered mother of pearl inlaid dining table with ebonised details, the circular moulded edge top with an inset lazy susan above a swag inlaid frieze, on a bold waisted and fluted column with a disc base and leaf carved feet. Inspired by a George III original in the Neo-Classical style.
image:image.image:title: Dover Street Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame mahogany console table, the lobed edge bowfront top centred by a fanned burl panel, above a frieze drawer on turned legs joined by an undertier. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: The Lobed Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame mahogany veneered and mother of pearl inlaid accent table, the line strung rectangular top above a slide and two sans traverse panelled drawers with fine brass mounts, on tapering legs. Inspired by a Louis XVI original.
image:image.image:title: Ansel Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame mahogany and Morado banded serpentine credenza, with brass mounts, one frieze drawer, mirror back, on fluted legs and undertier. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Fine Mirror Back Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A pollard oak burl & Morado banded cocktail table, mother of pearl & brass inlay to the oval top, end slides, undertier, square tapering legs.
image:image.image:title: Araminta Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and satinwood strung console table, the break-bowfront top with a brass inlaid edge above two frieze drawers and a yew burl veneered concealed drawer and corner panels, on ebonised and gilt reeded supports joined by a swirl mahogany and satinwood banded undertier, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.

image:image.image:caption: A steel and brass mounted accent table, the veined black marble top set within a brass moulded edge, on steel legs with brass beading and joined by an undertier, on elongated and tapering brass cast acanthus capital feet with brass terminals.

image:image.image:caption: A figured Anagre veneered and etched brass dresser, the rectangular top above a recessed illuminated etched brass frieze panel, above one row of three short drawers and two rows of two long drawers with self closing mechanism and with etched brass and wooden baton handles, all within a moulded frame, on similar legs.
image:image.image:title: London SW3 Dresser Dressers

image:image.image:caption: A finely morado crossbanded, sycamore line strung flame veneered and carved mahogany writing table, the concave sided top with a burnished leather and gold tooled insert to the top and end slides, with morado crossbanded frieze drawers, on fluted and turned tapering legs with fluted brass feet.
image:image.image:title: Fine Lines in Revolutionary France Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany scoop back accent chair, the curved padded back and with sweeping arms with beaded wooden details, the loose cushion seat and kidney pillow above sabre legs. Inspired by a 19th century Swedish original.
image:image.image:title: Mollie Upholstered Chair

image:image.image:caption: A fumed Eucalyptus veneered and brass mounted cocktail table, the oval tempered glass inset top within a bold veneered frieze, the gently tapered legs with bold brass mouldings. Inspired by an Art Deco original.
image:image.image:title: Bold Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A country house white painted open bookcase, the cavetto cornice above an architectural arch and keystone with column supports enclosing an open interior with LED lighting and a fixed shelf above two adjustable shelves. Inspired by a George III original. Designed to adjust to bunching with adjustable cornice and base.
image:image.image:title: Country House Reading Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: An ebonised mahogany, flame veneered and finely cast brass mounted console table, the rectangular brass edged top with canted corners above three frieze drawers with rococo brass handles, on chamfered Caryatid and floral mounted legs joined by an undertier. Inspired by a French original, circa 1770.
image:image.image:title: Flourish Console Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood Game chair, the arched back above projecting padded arms and an upholstered seat, on square tapering legs with spandrels joined by an 'X' stretcher and terminating in brass cappings and vinyl castors.
image:image.image:title: Game at Castle Bromwich Desk / Game Chair

image:image.image:caption: A flame walnut and morado crossbanded partner's pedestal desk, the serpentine moulded edge top centred by a well, each side with three frieze drawers and three further drawers to each pedestal, with tooled leather inlaid end slides and lockable side cabinets each enclosing an adjustable shelf, all on a plinth base.
image:image.image:title: English Partnership Pedestal Desk

image:image.image:caption: A fine flame veneered and brass lamp table, the square brass bound top above a brass mounted frieze drawer, on ebonised canted and chamfered legs with arched spandrels applied with a fine cast brass edge, the legs with Caryatid mounts joined by a brass bound undertier.
image:image.image:title: Flourish Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany, figured elm veneer and morado crossbanded cocktail table, the rectangular top with protruding angular corners and concave sides above a panelled frieze with two drawers to each side, above panelled morado veneered legs joined by wavy 'X' stretchers, on square tapering legs with brass feet.
image:image.image:title: Conyngham Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A finely hand carved and gilt Gothic revival armchair , the serpentine back enclosing interlacing Gothic arches, the scroll arms enclosing an upholstered seat with a serpentine seat rail trailing to moulded and bellflower capped cabbriole legs. The original George II.
image:image.image:title: The Gothic Library Side chair

image:image.image:caption: A finely hand carved and gilt Gothic revival armchair, the serpentine back enclosing interlacing Gothic arches, the scroll arms enclosing an upholstered seat with a serpentine seat rail trailing to moulded and bellflower capped cabbriole legs. The original George II.
image:image.image:title: The Gothic Library Armchair

image:image.image:caption: A verdigris brass sculpture of a roaring panther on a veined brown and cream marble base. Inspired by an Art Deco original.
image:image.image:title: Roar Decorative Accessory

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood parquetry cocktail table, the moulded edge top with two end frieze drawers with brass handles, on facetted capital turned tapering legs joined by serpentine 'X' stretchers. Inspired by a 17th century English original.
image:image.image:title: M'Lady's Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A chestnut burl veneered and flame veneered nightstand, the serpentine veneered top above three flame veneered serpentine drawers with drop handles and escutcheons, on a moulded base with bracket feet.

image:image.image:caption: A fine flame veneered chest of drawers, the bowfront satinwood crossbanded top with concave corners and uprights, above a veneered slide and four graduated bowfront drawers, with natural brass handles, on splay legs.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany veneered and yew burl banded dresser, the break bowfront top above an arrangement of four graduated yew burl centre drawers flanked by two columns of four bowed and line strung mahogany drawers, flanked by turned and tapering columns, on fluted peg feet with brass cappings.

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood breakfront dresser with lozenge parquetry top and drawer fronts, the moulded edge top above nine deep drawers with brass handles, on bracket feet.
image:image.image:title: Rustic Heirloom Dresser

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood dining table, the planked circular moulded edge top with a stellar parquetry medallion above a chevron parquetry tapering column, on a quatrefoil base with underscroll feet. Inspired by a Regency original.
image:image.image:title: The Regency Guest Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A set of two playing brass African elephants lying down and rolling over. Inspired by 19th century Austrian originals.

image:image.image:caption: A set of two large variously patinated brass cranes, standing on walking turtles. Inspired by 19th century Japanese Meiji period originals.

image:image.image:caption: A stainless steel and morado veneered lamp table, the circular bound top with ring pendants on inswept and splayed legs.

image:image.image:caption: A painted acacia side cabinet with scrolling vine painted decoration, the serpentine moulded edge top above two central doors flanked by two shaped side doors, each enclosing a white interior with an adjustable shelf, on bracket feet. Inspired by an 18th century Lombardy original.
image:image.image:title: Memories of an Italian Summer Sideboard

image:image.image:caption: A stainless steel drinks cart, with a rectangular hand silvered mirrored top surrounded by a partial pierced gallery and handles to the side, with open interlacing geometric sides and an open front and back, with two black lacquered bound tiers below, on stainless steel castors.
image:image.image:title: Cheers Drinks Cart

image:image.image:caption: A Brunello extending dining table, the circular parquetry top in oak, parawood and mahogany extending to accommodate two additional leaves on a turned waisted column with brass accents and fluted details, on a quatrefoil base with brass feet. Inspired by a 20th century Italian original.

image:image.image:caption: A morado veneered and mahogany Game table, the square top with a chessboard inlay within a faux shagreen and morado crossbanded border, the reverse with a backgammon board inlay, above a quarter round chequer banded moulded edge above a gently undulating apron with four faux shagreen inlaid drinks slides, on tapering legs with scroll feet.
image:image.image:title: Convivial Game Table

image:image.image:caption: A fine mahogany veneered and yew burl banded buffet, the break bowfront top with an ebony and brass inlaid edge, above an arrangement of four frieze drawers and central cabinet doors enclosing an adjustable shelf, flanked by two sets of three graduated drawers and turned and tapering columns, on line strung plinth base.
image:image.image:title: Donwell Buffet

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish swivel counter stool, the scoop back with turned slats enclosing a moulded seat, on square and turned legs joined by stretchers.

image:image.image:caption: A Hyedua veneered buffet, the rectangular top above four gradated lacquered doors, the interior in natural Sycamore with two adjustable shelves to the side cabinets, the centre with four drawers and a media shelf, above an inset simulated ebony veneered base with angular splayed and stainless steel capped feet.
image:image.image:title: Meiji Buffet

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and swirl veneered and crossbanded extending dining table, the rectangular top opening to accommodate two additional self storing leaves, the panelled satinwood veneered frieze above a bold base of four turned reeded columns on a platform base issuing four outswept legs with brass cappings.

image:image.image:caption: A Hyedua veneered buffet, the rectangular top above four silver Argento doors with relief bamboo decoration, the interior in Sycamore with two adjustable shelves to the side cabinets, the centre with four drawers and a shelf, above an inset ebonised veneered base with angular splayed and stainless steel capped feet.

image:image.image:caption: A Classical and brass engraved panel tapered torchere, the square top with a moulded edge above tapering sides, on a stepped plinth base. Inspired by a Louis XVI original.

image:image.image:caption: A finely cast stainless steel tablet computer stand with guilloche decoration.

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and solid mahogany twin pedestal extending dining table, the crossbanded reeded edge top with rounded corners opening to accommodate a matching leaf, above a banded frieze on two gun barrel turned columns each terminating in four downswept legs with brass castors.
image:image.image:title: The Regent's Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish and leather panelled console table, the rectangular verdigris brass gallery top above two frieze drawers, on turned and fluted legs joined by a brass galleried undertier. The original Louis XVI.

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish and leather panelled console table, the rectangular verdigris brass gallery top above two frieze drawers, on turned and fluted legs joined by a brass galleried undertier. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Byron's Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish and leather panelled console table, the rectangular verdigris brass gallery top above two frieze drawers, on turned and fluted legs joined by a brass galleried undertier. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Byron's Console Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood side cabinet, the rectangular top above a dentil moulded frieze over two parquetry doors enclosing an adjustable shelf on a moulded base raised on turned feet. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Sir John's Decorative Chest

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered corner cabinet, the upper section with an astragal glazed door enclosing lights and three glass adjustable shelves, above a frieze drawer and cabinet door below. Enclosing an adjustable shelf.

image:image.image:caption: A flame walnut veneered dining or centre table, the circular top above a waisted octagonal leather wrapped support, on an arch sided base.

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and brass mounted bureau plat desk, with a leather inset writing surface and three frieze drawers, on turned legs.

image:image.image:caption: A fine okumé veneered pedestal desk of curved outline, the leather inset top above a carved edge and three frieze drawers, one pedestal with three further short drawers, the other with a drawer and a filing drawer, joined by a modesty panel.

image:image.image:caption: A fine deep morado bureau plat writing desk, the leather inset brass moulded edge top above three shaped frieze drawers with Rocaille handles, on cabriole legs with fine brass mounts and sabots. The original Louis XV.
image:image.image:title: Royal Memoir Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and solid mahogany sideboard, the rectangular breakfront top above four frieze drawers applied with cast handles, above four lockable and panelled cabinet doors each enclosing an adjustable shelf and uprights, on turned and tapering feet terminating in brass cappings.

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood breakfront low media console, with three frieze drawers with verdigris brass handles open central section, on bracket feet. The side cabinets each enclosing an adjustable shelf. The original George III.

image:image.image:caption: A carpet découpage box on stand, with verdigris brass bound corners and mouldings, square chamfered legs and Chelaberd pattern. The original George III.

image:image.image:caption: A figured Ofram veneer writing table, the leather inset top above two faxu buffalo horn inset frieze drawers with stainless steel mounts, the S end supports with one cut out and a sycamore panel below, joined by a stainless steel stretcher.

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood lamp table, with two short and one long drawer, on bell turned legs joined by a wavy 'X' stretcher. The original William and Mary.

image:image.image:caption: An unusual mahogany and flame veneered hall bench, the arched hand carved toprail above swag carved panel back centred by the Spencer crest, the overscroll uprights with turned arms enclosing a solid seat, with a fluted seat rail above boldly splayed legs.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany lamp table with fine brass mounts, the serpentine antiqued glass and brass bound top above an end drawer, on cabriole legs with sabots.

image:image.image:title: In the Grand Manner Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued pine and polished sable three tier octagonal lamp table, the reeded edge tiers supported between eight turned and fluted columns on bun feet. The original French provincial.

image:image.image:caption: An upholstered wingback armchair, the arched back and wings above a cushion seat enclosed by overscrolled arms, on fluted tapering legs terminating in brass cappings. The original George III, circa 1770.

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved cocktail table, faux book spine carved frieze with two opposing drawers and a leather inset top, verdigris brass roundels, spiral turned legs, 'x' stretcher. The original William and Mary.

image:image.image:caption: A Kalahari wrapped luggage style bedside chest of drawers with brass bound corners, the leather inlaid top above three drawers applied with leather strap handles, on bun feet.

image:image.image:title: The Fireside Games Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A late mahogany settee, the shaped waisted back with serpentine uprights above an upholstered seat, on elegant moulded cabriole legs terminating in spade feet. Based on the original very large set designed by George Seddon circa 1800. The original George III.

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and brass mounted bureau plat desk, with a leather inset writing surface and three frieze drawers, on turned legs.

image:image.image:caption: A rustic white hand-painted chest of drawers, the serpentine top above two long drawers with flame veneered panels and fine Rocaille handles and escutcheons, on cabriole legs.

image:image.image:caption: Olive Ash burl veneerHand Cast Brass
image:image.image:title: The XS Cocktail Table

Inspired by the 2nd Earl Spencer, appointed 1st Lord of the Admiralty in 1795. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Admiralty Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered partners' desk, the serpentine, tooled leather inset top fitted with three frieze drawers to one side and two slides and drawers to the other, each side also with one pedestal containing four drawers and a cabinet flanking each kneehole, the ends each with ten dummy drawers on serpentine plinth bases.

image:image.image:caption: A rustic painted hoop back bench, the triple arched back with turned slats and arms with turned uprights, the shaped seat above turned splayed legs. Inspired by an 18th century Hickory original.

image:image.image:title: Classical Torchère

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered bureau cabinet, the domed top with turned finials, the glazed door enclosing pigeon holes, 23 drawers and a mirror panel cupboard, flanked by five drawers to each side, above a sloping fall opening to reveal a fitted interior and a leather writing surface, above five drawers, on bracket feet
image:image.image:title: The King William Bedroom Bureau Cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A nest of two ash burl tables, the moulded edge rectangular tops above delicate turned and fluted end supports on sleigh feet. The originals Regency.
image:image.image:title: Perfect Nest of Tables

image:image.image:caption: An flame veneered break bowfront 'Console Dessert' with fine brass mounts, the white veined black marble top above three frieze drawers, the mirror back below before panelled square legs joined by two brass gallery undertiers, on square tapering legs with brass feet.
image:image.image:title: Victorian Break Bowfront Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A morado and elegantly turned cast brass three tier étagère, the rectangular pierced repeating arch brass gallery top and brass bound lower tiers between brass columns terminating in brass castors. The original by Mallets of London. Sold at auction for $6000.
image:image.image:title: Dignified Morado Étagère Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany armchair in the manner of Thomas Hope, the bowed and panel carved toprail above a ‘U’ shaped seat, turned armrests with lions head carved finials, the seat-rails decorated with trailing husk carving on downswept moulded legs terminating in lion paw feet. The original Regency, circa 1805.
image:image.image:title: Thomas Hope Accent Chair

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood drop-leaf refectory dining table, the shaped parquetry top with two drop leaves on twin baluster turned end supports, hand carved sleigh feet joined by a pegged stretcher. The original 17th century.
image:image.image:title: English Evening Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood oval refectory dining table, the planked top above hand carved double turned baluster legs joined by a pegged stretcher. The original 17th century.
image:image.image:title: Generations at the Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A verdigris brass hurricane lamp, the base with a spiral cast ball centre on an octagonal base surmounted by a blown glass shade. Inspired by a Renaissance original.
image:image.image:title: Old English Hurricane Table Lamp

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered serpentine lamp table, with a frieze drawer, verdigris brass mounts, cabriole legs, paw feet.
image:image.image:title: Paw-Footed Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A verdigris brass mounted seven tier étagère in two folding parts, the folding shelves between X supports and sides. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Folding Etagère

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and morado banded torchère, the square canted edge Brabancon marble top above a flared body with fine brass moulding, on a plinth base with concave cut-out corners.
image:image.image:title: Moreau Torchere

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered bureau plat desk, the serpentine brass bound top above five drawers creating a kneehole, on square fluted legs.
image:image.image:title: Academia Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A morado veneered bureau plat, the serpentine brass bound moulded edge top inset with a gilt tooled leather writing surface, above three serpentine frieze drawers fitted with Rococo brass handles on cabriole legs with brass cartouche mounts trailing to sabots.
image:image.image:title: The Princess of Wales Bedroom Bureau Plat Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved and inlaid Game table, the reversible chess and hand tooled leather inlaid top revealing a backgammon board below, the frieze with two opposing end drawers, on spiral turned legs joined by an 'X' stretcher. The original William and Mary.
image:image.image:title: Spiral Turned Game Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood cocktail table, the rounded re-entrant corners above splayed lyre end supports joined by wrought iron stretchers. The original 17th century Portuguese.
image:image.image:title: The Country Lyre Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A brass mounted lamp table, the circular flame veneered top on delicate brass legs terminating in lion paw feet united by a trefoil concave undertier centred by the Spencer crest.
image:image.image:title: Trefoil Spencer Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and ormolu mounted occasional table, the brass bound shaped circular top above a morado veneered frieze enclosed by foliate mounts, on three cabriole legs with caryatid mounts terminating in sabots, united by a shaped undertier.
image:image.image:title: Caryatids Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame walnut veneered lamp table, the circular top and undertier between curved rectangular supports centred by a glass shelf. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: Walnut Reflection Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and parcel gilt Bergère, the arched and padded scoop back with a carved toprail leading to part padded and sinuously scrolled arms and uprights enclosing a cushion seat above a fluted and paterae decorated frieze on turned and fluted legs terminating in peg feet. The original Regency, circa 1830.
image:image.image:title: The Spencer Study chair

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany side chair after Chippendale, serpentine toprail, pierced vase splat, upholstered drop in seat, square chamfered legs and stretchers. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: The Great Room Dining Chair

image:image.image:caption: A circular lamp table, brass gallery, brown leather top and undertier, frieze drawer, square and cabriole legs. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Louis XVI Circle Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A fine okumé veneered pedestal desk of curved outline, the leather inset top above a carved edge and three frieze drawers, one pedestal with three further short drawers, the other with a drawer and a filing drawer, joined by a modesty panel.
image:image.image:title: Boardroom Desk

image:image.image:caption: A brass engraved and solid acacia nest of two tables, both with finely brass engraved panel tops with nail head trim borders on barley twist legs joined by similar stretchers, the smaller table with a frieze drawer. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Lightly Engraved Nest of Tables

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered writing table, the tooled leather inset top with protruding rounded corners above three frieze drawers on turned legs with brass castors.
image:image.image:title: Man of Letters Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered Campaign dressing table, the hinged fold over and leather inlaid top, the interior fitted with pigeonholes and hinged top compartments, the central compartment with a mirror, on square tapering legs joined by stretchers and terminating in spade feet.
image:image.image:title: Elegance and Utility Dressing Table

image:image.image:caption: An opaque white art glass vase, with hand ground decoration. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: White Element Vase

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood open bookcase, with two frieze drawers, open adjustable shelves below, on a plinth base. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Katherine Low Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: A side chair, the upholstered sling back and seat with nail head decoration, on turned and splayed legs. The original Mid Century Modern.
image:image.image:title: Leather Sling Dining Chair

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered writing table, the tooled leather inset top with protruding rounded corners above three frieze drawers on turned legs with brass castors.
image:image.image:title: Man of Letters Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A narrow Sheraton library bookcase, the upper section with a moulded cornice above an icicle frieze over two glazed doors with oval astragals enclosing a velvet lined interior with glass shelves and touch lights, the cabinet with a frieze drawer above oval inlaid doors on splayed bracket feet.
image:image.image:title: Niche Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: A burl veneer and solid acacia three tier lamp table, the dished oval tray top and two undertiers between baluster turned supports, on turned and tapering legs terminating in brass castors. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Appetizer Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A burl lattice parquetry, brass mounted console table, four frieze drawers, on turned and fluted legs joined by an undertier. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Burl Lattice Parquetry, Brass Mounted Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A bowfront flame veneered and oval pollard oak burl panel inlaid side cabinet or buffet, the brass bound top above three frieze drawers above four cabinet doors enclosing three adjustable shelves, flanked by brass mounted columns, on a plinth base.
image:image.image:title: In the Empire Style side cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and brass mounted bureau plat desk, with a leather inset writing surface and three frieze drawers, on turned legs.
image:image.image:title: Tales from France Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany Bergère library armchair, the button upholstered back above scroll arms enclosing a cushion seat, the close nailed uprights on turned legs terminating in brass cappings and castors. The original Regency, circa 1835 in the Billiard Room, Althorp.
image:image.image:title: The Billiard Room Upholstered Chair

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood side table, the trough shaped tray top with pierced handles above a frieze drawer, on splayed legs joined by a part galleried planked undertier. The original George II.
image:image.image:title: The Herb Garden Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A verdigris brass two tier butler's tray, 'x' supports for two dished rectangular removable burl trays, tubular supports with finials. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Butler's Tray Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued mahogany wing armchair, the padded arched toprail and wings enclosing a slatted chevron parquetry back, with padded arms and a cushion seat, on splayed legs. The original Swedish, circa 1920.
image:image.image:title: The Castle Fireside Upholstered Chair

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved side chair, with arched bowed bar back, upholstered seat, on turned and fluted tapering legs. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Atelier Side chair

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered cocktail table, the square top with breakfront sides, the floral repoussé brass panel frieze and three drawers to two sides interspersed with flowerhead paterae and fluted sections, on brass capital fluted legs joined by a concave sided and reeded edge undertier. Inspired by a Louis XVI original.
image:image.image:title: Classical Gathering Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A fine flame veneered console table, the concave sided top with a fine brass gallery above a central panelled frieze drawer, on turned, brass capital and fluted legs joined by a galleried undertier on peg feet.
image:image.image:title: Cornwallis Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered lamp table, the circular line strung and brass bound top, on 'S' scroll legs fully veneered in pollard oak burl; the outer ebonised edge of the legs flanked by hand leafed gilt mouldings.
image:image.image:title: Inward Looking Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A Campaign desk, the flip top revealing a fitted interior, leather writing surface, on splayed legs. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Kaye Campaign Desk

image:image.image:caption: A silvered and gilt verre églomisé two tiered cocktail table, the dished moulded edge oval top and similar undertier between octagonal section supports on similar tapering legs with brass cappings. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: Palace Decoration Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: An envelope game table, the brown leather inset top turning and opening from the centre to reveal counter bowls to the corners and a tooled leather playing surface; the frieze with a drawer, on square tapering legs with spade feet joined by a concave sided and leather inset galleried undertier. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: The Georgian Envelope Game Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood stellar parquetry side cabinet, the top above two drawers and cabinet doors with star inset panels each enclosing an adjustable shelf on bracket feet. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Orlando Decorative Chest

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood circular extending dining table, the circular top of parquetry panels with six pull-out sections revealing self-storing fold-out leaves, above four baluster turned supports, on a crossover scroll foot base. The original 17th century English.
image:image.image:title: Sylvan Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A hickory open bookcase, the leather inlaid top above two frieze drawers with adjustable open shelves below, on turned legs. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Characteristic Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: A faux book panel circular lamp table, verdigris brass mounts, aged brown leather top and undertier, drawer and cabinet, turned fluted legs. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Louis XVI library Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A Campaign and verdigris brass filing pedestal chest of drawers, with three drawers, on bun feet. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Notes for Safekeeping Chest

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood lamp table, with a polished iron scrolling 'X' support base with a verdigris brass finial. The original French Provincial.
image:image.image:title: From the Gardener's Studio Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and verdigris brass lamp table, the circular flame veneered top with a pierced brass gallery on a floriate turned column with fluted and acanthus scroll base on lion paw feet.
image:image.image:title: Delights of France Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered open bookcase, with two frieze drawers, two adjustable shelves, on Corinthian column supports and bun feet.
image:image.image:title: The Corinthian's Library Low Bookcase

image:image.image:caption: A hickory and leather parquetry cocktail table, the rectangular top a long frieze drawer, on bell turned legs joined by an 'X' stretcher.
image:image.image:title: The William and Mary Garden Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A morado and brass strung console table, the rectangular brass edged top above an inswept tulip base on a sweeping stepped plinth base. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: The Tulip Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A demi-lune console table, the faux marble painted top above a frieze drawer and panelled sides, with gilt decoration of trailing vines, on silvered acanthus leaf carved capital turned and fluted legs. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: The Silvered Leaf Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and ormolu mounted card table, the shaped rectangular fold over top turning and opening to reveal a leather inset playing surface with counter bowls to each corner, above a mask centred frieze and on cabriole legs with Rococo cartouche mounts terminating in sabots.
image:image.image:title: Chance Game Table

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish and leather panelled console table, the rectangular verdigris brass gallery top above two frieze drawers, on turned and fluted legs joined by a brass galleried undertier. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Byron's Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A carved mahogany and parcel gilt hall bench, the reeded solid seat with lapette carved and scroll end supports, loose button upholstered seat cushion, on turned fluted and tapering legs. The original Regency circa 1820 in the manner of George Bullock. Sold at auction in London for $7,000.
image:image.image:title: The Hall Bench

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany demi lune console of small proportions, fitted with two central frieze drawers applied with brass handles and locks, on square tapering legs terminating in brass feet joined by an undertier.
image:image.image:title: Demi Lune Accent Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and mahogany extending dining table, the rectangular top extending to accommodate two additional leaves, the edge carved with floral details, on spiral turned column supports and legs.
image:image.image:title: Medieval Revival Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany framed Library Armchair, the gently overscrolled back above downswept arms enclosing a padded seat above a moulded seat-rail with brass roundels to each corner on four fluted sabre legs terminating in brass cappings and castors. The original Regency, circa 1810.
image:image.image:title: The Sabre leg Upholstered Chair

image:image.image:caption: A solid oak and flame veneered three tier lamp table, each elongated octagonal tier with a three quarter pierced brass gallery, on shaped end supports with lozenge ornaments, terminating in splayed feet.
image:image.image:title: The Sometime Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood fold-over Campaign desk, the hinged top opening to reveal four fitted drawers, on twin baluster turned end supports and sleigh feet joined by a pegged stretcher. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Inglenook Campaign Desk

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and lacquer chest of two drawers, the ends and two drawer fronts hand decorated in Chinoiserie scenes on figured mahogany, with finely cast brass mouldings, ring drop handles and a faux marble painted top.
image:image.image:title: Graceful Chinoiserie Commode

image:image.image:caption: A marquetry inlaid lamp table, the circular top with swirling teardrop inlays in morado and burl veneers with a sunburst parquetry crossbanding above a bowed frieze drawer, on inswept supports with scroll feet applied with brass rosettes, the concave sided inlaid undertier on brass paw feet. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Burl Swirls Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A bedside chest or lamp table with Classical landscape découpage decoration, the rectangular dished tray top above three cockbeaded long drawers applied with brass handles, on turned and fluted tapering legs joined by turned stretchers terminating in brass cappings. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Arcadia Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A poplar burl chest of drawers, the rectangular moulded edge top above two short and three long graduated drawers, on bracket feet. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: Hill House Chest

image:image.image:caption: A poplar burl Campaign desk, the flip top opening to reveal a fitted interior and a leather inset writing surface, five drawers below, tapering legs and stretchers. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: Mentioned in Dispatches Campaign Desk

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany telescopic reading table, the octagonal tilt-top adjustable on a brass column, the turned support on splayed outswept legs with acanthus leaf mounts. The original circa 1810. The Library.
image:image.image:title: The Library Telescopic Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A morado and pollard banded circular dining table, with a carved edge and four frieze drawers with brass handles, the hexagonal column issuing outswept reeded legs on castors. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Lavinia's Supper Party Centre Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and iridescent gilded verre églomisé panelled cocktail table, the rectangular top with protruding rounded corners, on turned and fluted tapering legs joined by an undertier, the sides with cast brass ‘X’ stretchers, the legs terminating in finely cast brass cappings. The original Empire.
image:image.image:title: Empire Reflections Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered accent table, the rectangular top with rounded protruding corners and one frieze drawer, on turned legs joined by an undertier.
image:image.image:title: Pied-à-terre Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and brass mounted bureau plat desk, with a leather inset writing surface and three frieze drawers, on turned legs.
image:image.image:title: Tales from France Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany Nursing chair, the button upholstered back and circular seat on bobbin turned legs terminating in brass cappings and castors. The original Victorian, circa 1880.
image:image.image:title: The Cocktail Upholstered Chair

image:image.image:caption: A curious umbrella stand, the three verdigris brass and leather strapped 19th century Can Can boots joined by a rope-twist and hand gilt centre issuing tassels and a brass carrying handle. Inspired by a 19th century French original.
image:image.image:title: Curious Umbrella Stand

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood cocktail table, with parquetry inlay, the rectangular top with two end drawers, on bell turned legs joined by an 'X' stretcher. The original William and Mary.
image:image.image:title: The Rustic Parquetry Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood cocktail table, with two end drawers, on turned legs joined by an "X" stretcher. The original William and Mary.
image:image.image:title: The Antiqued Cocktail Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany candle stand, the circular moulded edge top on a delicately turned baluster column terminating in a dished and moulded circular brass bound platform base.
image:image.image:title: Sunderland Candle Stand

image:image.image:caption: An ebonised, gilt and painted circular lamp table, with brass bound top and turned column, on tripod cabriole legs. The original Victorian after Jennings and Betteridge.
image:image.image:title: The Jennings and Betteridge Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and walnut banded cabinet, the moulded edge top above a frieze with a leather inset slide and two drawers, with two panelled and crossbanded cabinet doors below with brass lion mask roundels to the corners, enclosing an adjustable shelf, on turned and gadrooned peg feet with brass cappings and castors.
image:image.image:title: The Shakespeare Cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A verdigris brass and leather panelled floor lamp, the urn capital and square base with lion paw feet, surmounted by a hand sewn silk shade. The original Napoleon III.
image:image.image:title: Empire Standard Floor Lamp

image:image.image:caption: A walnut and burl sunburst parquetry lamp table, brass gallery and scroll legs, frieze drawer, hoof feet. The original Napoleon III.
image:image.image:title: Napoleon Sunburst Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood bowfront console table, the bowed frieze drawer above arched aprons, turned supports and feet, joined by an undertier. The original 17th century Italian.
image:image.image:title: The Bowfront Country Console

image:image.image:caption: An oak and movingue demi-lune side cabinet, with carved and gilt decoration the bow fronted brass gallery top above a frieze drawer, with cabinet doors below enclosing an adjustable shelf, on turned legs. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Finely Traced side cabinet

image:image.image:caption: A carpet découpage lamp table, with a frieze drawer on square chamfered legs. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: Hammadan Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood lamp table, the circular top above a bowed floating frieze between turned supports joined by a planked circular undertier with a plain frieze, on turned feet. The original 17th century.
image:image.image:title: Sir John's Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and silvered verre églomisé panelled lamp table, the square brass bound top with rounded protruding corners, the two panelled frieze drawers and sides with gilt decoration of trailing vines, on turned and fluted, tapering legs terminating in brass cappings. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Waterside Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany, morado and line strung secrétaire en abbatant, the marble top above brass mounted columns, two drawers and three faux drawers enclosing a fall front, revealing a fitted desk with a tooled leather writing surface, above three drawers all applied with brass fittings, on turned, tapering and brass capped legs.
image:image.image:title: The Princess of Wales Bedroom Fall Front Desk & Bureaux

image:image.image:caption: A light faux bamboo carved and mahogany serpentine console table, the crossbanded top above two panelled frieze drawers with brass handles, on tapering legs joined by brass 'X' stretchers. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Edwardian Bamboo Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A sable, silver painted and floral decorated Queen Bed frame, the leaf carved serpentine head and footboard, on carved cabriole legs. The original Louis XV.
image:image.image:title: Enchanted Evening (US Queen)

image:image.image:caption: A fine verdigris brass floor lamp, the naturalistically cast branch stem and base surmounted by a silk cylinder shade with cast brass rims. The original Mid Century Modern.
image:image.image:title: Toward The Light Floor Lamps

image:image.image:caption: An acacia side cabinet with brass engraved panels, with two frieze drawers above two cabinet doors each enclosing a leather inset adjustable shelf, on bracket feet. The original Renaissance.
image:image.image:title: George III Pattern-Maker Decorative Chest

image:image.image:caption: An ebonised and gilt two tier chocolate Chinoiserie side table, with gallery undertier, lyre end supports and similar undertier, on downswept legs. The original Louis XVI.

image:image.image:caption: A fine hand carved gilt wood wall mirror after John Linnell, the acanthus ‘C’ scroll framed marginal plates with a shell and cartouche crest enclosing a rectangular lattice astragal antiqued mirror plate. The original George III, circa 1770. From a Private London Collection.
image:image.image:title: The Linnell ‘C’ Scroll Wall Mirror

image:image.image:caption: A crossbanded flame veneered and solid mahogany twin pedestal extending dining table, the moulded edge top with rounded corners above a plain frieze opening to accommodate an additional leaf, on baluster turned column supports issuing downswept legs terminating in brass castors.
image:image.image:title: The Kensington Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A Pacific walnut lamp table, the modern circular piecrust top on an octagonal column issuing tripod cabriole legs. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: Modern Piecrust Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A painted red lacquer demi-lune side cabinet, the brass bound bowfront top above a long frieze drawer, with four cabinets below, each enclosing an adjustable shelf, on square tapering legs. The original 19th century Japanese.
image:image.image:title: The Traveller's Decorative Chest

image:image.image:caption: A Campaign and brass filing chest of drawers, with six drawers and on bun feet. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Subaltern's Chest

image:image.image:caption: An imbuya burl and Chocolate Chinoiserie hand-painted lamp table, the rectangular top with a fine brass gallery above ring turned legs joined by an undertier. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Spectator's Gallery Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A Brunello lamp table, the square parquetry top above a frieze drawer, on square tapering legs joined by a stretcher. The original 19th century Italian.
image:image.image:title: Wine Country Side Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood parquetry nest of three tables, the tables each with a plain frieze, on turned legs and stretchers. The original 17th century.
image:image.image:title: Orchard Nest of Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood, brass and iron Campaign bunching cocktail table, the square stellar parquetry top on square verdigris legs joined by 'X' sides.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and ormolu mounted lamp table, the rectangular top with a moulded brass edge above a lockable frieze drawer, on cabriole legs with Rococo mounts terminating in sabots.

image:image.image:caption: A Military Campaign Wellington tall chest of drawers, with inset brass handles and leather panel drawers, with lockable uprights, on a plinth base. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: In the Field Chest

image:image.image:caption: A small antiqued wood circular extending dining table, the top with pull out leaves and fold-out extenders, above a tapered column and a quatrefoil downscroll base. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: Antique from The Hall Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and brass mounted bureau plat desk, with a leather inset writing surface and three frieze drawers, on turned legs.
image:image.image:title: Tales from France Writing Table

image:image.image:caption: A Byron finish bar stool, the shaped plank seat with bold brass bolts, on a gunmetal iron base.
image:image.image:title: Hardy Byron Stool

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany, flame veneered and walnut banded chest of drawers, the bowfront top above four oval panel inlaid drawers on splay feet.
image:image.image:title: Lady Jersey's Chest

image:image.image:caption: A burl veneer and parquetry inlaid crossbanded dining or centre table, the circular top crossbanded in morado and centred by a stellar motif, above a baluster turned column with a gadrooned base, on a trefoil concave base raised on finely brass mounted scroll corbel feet. The original Regency.
image:image.image:title: High Tea Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood parquetry chest of drawers, with three breakfront drawers and brass handles, on a plinth base. The original 18th century Italian.
image:image.image:title: Recollections from the Castle Chest

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and mahogany lamp table, the square top above a fluted frieze and a hand worked 'bronzed' repoussé panel drawer, each corner applied with brass paterae, on Corinthian capital and turned fluted legs joined by a concave sided and crossbanded undertier, on turned feet.
image:image.image:title: Corinthian Columns Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and burl lattice parquetry nest of two tables, with turned end supports and on splay feet. The original Regency.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered cocktail table, the rectangular top above a floral 'bronzed' repoussé panel frieze with two end drawers interspersed with flowerhead paterae and fluted sections, on brass capital fluted legs joined by a concave sided and reeded edge undertier. Inspired by a Louis XVI original.

image:image.image:caption: A circular poplar burl lamp table, the burl veneer top with a patinated brass pierced gallery and similar undertier above a single bowed burl frieze drawer, square panelled supports on cabriole legs terminating in brass sabots. The original Louis XVI.

image:image.image:title: The Slice Nest Of Tables

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and mahogany lamp table, the circular top above a fluted frieze and a hand worked 'bronzed' repoussé panel drawer, on Corinthian capital and turned fluted legs joined by a concave sided trefoil undertier, on turned feet.

image:image.image:caption: A fine okumé veneered pedestal desk of curved outline, the leather inset top above a carved edge and three frieze drawers, one pedestal with three further short drawers, the other with a drawer and a filing drawer, joined by a modesty panel.

image:image.image:caption: A hand carved pedestal desk, with a leather inset top, three frieze drawers, one pedestal with cupboard the other with two drawers and a filing drawer. The original French Provincial.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and iridescent gilded verre églomisé panelled side table, the square top with protruding rounded corners, on turned and fluted tapering legs joined by an undertier, the back and sides with cast brass ‘X’ stretchers, the legs terminating in finely cast brass cappings. The original Empire.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany, flame veneered and morado banded console table applied with very fine brass mounts, the brass bound top with a frieze drawer , on ram's head capital cabriole legs with hoof feet joined by an undertier.

image:image.image:caption: A narrow burl veneer and acacia console table, the rectangular top with rounded corners and a brass gallery, above four frieze drawers, supported on six turned and fluted legs joined by a galleried undertier, on block and turned peg legs terminating in brass cappings. The original Louis XV.
image:image.image:title: The Narrow Console Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and mahogany kidney shaped lamp table, the three quarter brass gallery top above a hand grab frieze drawer flanked by fine brass capitals to the cabriole legs joined by an undertier.
image:image.image:title: Louis XV's 1770 Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and mahogany, brass inlaid drum top centre table, the circular top inlaid with a band of scrolling leaves, the frieze fitted with a centre drawer, on a turned and tapering column with lapette carved base, on a concave sided brass strung plinth with rosette corners, on lobed bun feet.

image:image.image:caption: A flame veneered and solid mahogany twin pedestal extending dining table, the crossbanded reeded edge top with rounded corners opening to accommodate a matching leaf, above a banded frieze on two gun barrel turned columns each terminating in four downswept legs with brass castors.

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood parquetry cocktail table, the rectangular top on square tapering legs. The original Victorian.

image:image.image:title: The Wootton Hall Accent Chair

Inspired by the 2nd Earl Spencer, appointed 1st Lord of the Admiralty in 1795. The original Regency.

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany lamp table, the square three quarter brass galleried top on ring turned legs joined by stretchers, the underside with two removable ‘X’ stand, fold-out circular occasional tables.
image:image.image:title: Ingenious Nest of Tables

image:image.image:caption: An iridescent gilded verre églomisé panel console table, the bow front top above a frieze drawer and on ring turned tapering legs joined by two undertiers. The original 20th century Italian.
image:image.image:title: Chromatic Console Table

image:image.image:caption: An antiqued wood dresser base, with four deep drawers, serpentine apron, on turned legs joined by a planked undertier. The original 17th century.
image:image.image:title: Upper Kitchen Dresser Sideboard

image:image.image:caption: A Campaign desk, the flip top revealing a fitted interior, leather writing surface, on splayed legs. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Kaye Campaign Desk

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and flame veneered circular breakfast or dining table, the circular top with a brass mounted frieze, on a turned column supports issuing four outswept legs with lion and disc feet.
image:image.image:title: Mahogany Circular Breakfast / Dining Table

image:image.image:caption: A Campaign desk, the flip top revealing a fitted interior, leather writing surface, on splayed legs. The original Victorian.
image:image.image:title: The Kaye Campaign Desk

image:image.image:caption: A simulated macassar ebony, stainless steel mounted and Kalahari panelled bowfront side cabinet, the panelled top and sides above four cabinet doors each enclosing an adjustable shelf. The original Art Deco.
image:image.image:title: Curves and Kalahari Sideboard

image:image.image:caption: An oval poplar burl lamp table, the burl veneer top with a patinated brass pierced gallery and similar undertier above a single bowed burl frieze drawer, square panelled supports on cabriole legs terminating in brass sabots. The original Louis XVI.
image:image.image:title: Delicate and Pierced Accent Table

image:image.image:caption: A mahogany and burl swirl marquetry inlaid tripod circular lamp table, with carved fluted and turned column, on cabriole legs. The original George III.
image:image.image:title: The Swirl-Top Side Table

image:image.image:caption: A hickory open bookcase, the rectangular top with rounded corners above two frieze drawers and open adjustable shelves below on cabriole legs. The original French Provincial.
